task_description: Facing the building to your North (approx. 341°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need to see the full height of the building to estimate it, so I will start by looking up to find the roof.
I still cannot see the top of the building, so I need to tilt my view further upwards to see the roofline.
I still can't see the top of the building, so I need to look up even further to see the roof.
I have tilted up as far as I can but still can't see the roof, so I need to move further away from the building to get a better vantage point.
I have moved back, but now I am facing the wrong direction; I need to turn back towards the building (originally at 342°) and reset my pitch to level before looking up again.
I am facing the wrong direction and looking down; I need to turn to face the building (originally at 342°) and look up to see its full height.
I am still not facing the target building, which is to the North (around 342°), so I need to rotate right and look down to get a level view before reassessing.
I am facing the wrong way and looking down; I need to rotate to face the building at approximately 342° and level my view to re-evaluate.
I am still facing the wrong direction; I need to rotate right by about 114 degrees to face the target building (originally at 342°) and simultaneously look down to level my view.
I am facing away from the building and looking down; I need to turn left towards North (approx. 342°) and look up to level my view before I can see the building again.
I am disoriented; I need to face the building which is at approximately 342° and level my view by looking down before I can properly assess its height.
I am completely disoriented; I need to reset my view by turning to face the building at approximately 342° and leveling my pitch to 0° before attempting to view the building's height again.
I am stuck in a loop and disoriented; I will try to reset my view by first leveling my pitch to 0 and then turning to face the building at 342° in a separate step.
I have successfully leveled my pitch, but I am looking at the ground; now I need to look up to see the building.
I am now looking up at the building from a distance; I can see it has approximately 4 floors, and with an average floor height of 3.5 meters plus the roof structure, I can estimate its height.
